snippet: Federal prosecutors spent three weeks presenting evidence against the reputed mobster. His fast acquittal could signal a change in public feeling toward Mafia informants.
abstract: Lawyers and experts say jury's acquittal of mob associate Vincent Asaro on charges of helping organize 1978 robbery at Kennedy International Airport was likely due to juror bias against Mafia informants and lack of hard evidence; jurors may also have been overwhelmed by large amount of unhelpful evidence.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors spent three weeks presenting evidence against the reputed mobster. His fast acquittal could signal a change in public feeling toward Mafia informants.

headline.main: Acquittal of Vincent Asaro Is Latest Setback in Mafia Prosecutions
headline.print_headline: Mafia Trial Acquittal Attributed to Copious and Unconvincing Evidence
